etymology.description: 炒 (stir-fry) + 蛋 (egg) = stir-fried egg(s) → scrambled eggs.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “stir-fried egg,” referring to eggs cooked by stir-frying, i.e., scrambled eggs. Often implies quickly cooked, soft curds and may include seasonings or add-ins.

parts.english: to stir-fry; to fry; to sauté; to speculate (market)

examples.chinese: 早上我喜欢吃番茄炒蛋(早上我喜歡吃番茄炒蛋)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎoshang wǒ xǐhuan chī fānqié chǎodàn.
examples.english: In the morning I like to eat tomato scrambled eggs.

examples.chinese: 他用小火慢慢炒蛋，口感更嫩(他用小火慢慢炒蛋，口感更嫩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng xiǎohuǒ mànman chǎodàn, kǒugǎn gèng nèn.
examples.english: He uses low heat to slowly scramble the eggs; the texture is more tender.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅的炒蛋很香，很滑(這家餐廳的炒蛋很香，很滑)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng de chǎodàn hěn xiāng, hěn huá.
examples.english: The scrambled eggs at this restaurant are fragrant and silky.
